creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Freely sketched trees on a gentle embankment at left; open space with distant mounds at right; two tiny figures near the trees.
dimension: 2 1/2 × 2 1/4 in. (6.35 × 5.72 cm) (as cut from original sheet)
marks:
Signature, Marks

in graphite on verso: [*E.G. K initialed in plate, lower right: [CL. inv.]
provenance: Edward G. Kennedy; New York Public Library; [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until March 5, 1985; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Two Landscapes (Right)
